Sanitize object prior to hashing

Source: R/hashing.R
st_sanitize_for_hash.Rd

For tabular data we want hashing to depend only on the data/frame content, not on volatile data.table internals (e.g. .internal.selfref) or differing row name representations. Strategy:

  • If x is a data.table: coerce to plain data.frame (drops DT internals).

  • If x is a data.frame (including coerced DT): enforce deterministic row.names via .set_row_names(NROW(x)) and preserve original row.names in st_original_rownames attribute for later restoration.

  • Record original class in st_original_format so a loader can restore it.

Usage

st_sanitize_for_hash(x)

Details

Non-tabular objects are returned unchanged (attribute normalization handles them subsequently).

NOTE: The returned object is a shallow copy; column data is not duplicated.
